article.title: String_Quartet_No._16_%28Beethoven%29
article.paragraph: TheString Quartet No. 16inF major,Opus numberop.135, byLudwig van Beethovenwas written in October 1826cite bookSteinbergMichaelRobert Winter, Robert MartinThe Beethoven Quartet Companion274University of California Press19940-520-08211-7and was the last substantial work he finished. Only the last movement of theString Quartet No. 13 (Beethoven)Quartet op. 130, written as a replacement for theGroe Fuge, was written later. The op. 135 quartet was premiered by theSchuppanzigh Quartetin March 1828.

The work is on a smaller scale than his other late quartets. For the third movement, Beethoven used variation techniques; he also did this in the second movement of hisString Quartet No. 12 (Beethoven)Quartet op. 127.Bernard Jacobson. "Beethoven: The Complete String Quartets." EMI 5736062. CD liner notes, 24.Under the introductory slow chords in the last movement Beethoven wrote in the manuscript "Mu es sein?" (Must it be?) to which he responds, with the faster main theme of the movement, "Es mu sein!" (It must be!). The whole movement is headed "Der schwer gefate Entschlu" ("The Difficult Decision").
